alert.note: Alert for Dorchester; Wicomico (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 18 at 2:06AM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Maryland, including the following counties, Dorchester. * WHEN...Until 700 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 206 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. This rainfall will combine with flooding tides resulting in areas of widespread flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cambridge, Hurlock, Sharptown, Secretary, Vienna, University Of Maryland Center For Environmental Studies, East New Market, Mardela Springs, Galestown, Church Creek, Brookview, Eldorado, Bucktown, Linkwood, Andrews, Elliott, Woolford, Lloyds, Madison and Honga. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
